environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Hansch C et al; Exploring QSAR Hydrophobic, Electronic, and Steric Constants. ACS Professional Reference Book. Heller SR, (consult ed) Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc pg. 15 (1995) (2) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods. Washington DC: Amer Chem Soc pp. 5-4, 5-10 (1990) (3) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF value of 5.8 was calculated for neopentyl alcohol(SRC), using an experimental log Kow of 1.31(1) and a recommended regression-derived equation(2). According to a recommended classification scheme(3), this BCF value suggests that bioconcentration in aquatic organisms will not be an important fate process(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Boethling RD et al; Environ Sci Technol 28: 459-65 (1994)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: Although no biodegradation data are available for neopentyl alcohol, the quarternary carbon structure would suggest that biodegradation may be slow(1).

logP.References: Hansch, C., Leo, A., D. Hoekman. Exploring QSAR - Hydrophobic, Electronic, and Steric Constants. Washington, DC: American Chemical Society., 1995., p. 15

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Browning, E. Toxicity and Metabolism of Industrial Solvents. New York: American Elsevier, 1965., p. 358
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ALL ISOMERS OF AMYL ALCOHOL ARE.../CNS DEPRESSANTS/, & IN HIGH DOSAGE LETHAL TO ANIMALS... /PENTANOLS/

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Snyder, R. (ed.). Ethel Browning's Toxicity and Metabolism of Industrial Solvents. Second Edition. Volume 3 Alcohols and Esters. New York, NY: Elsevier, 1992., p. 132
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: 2,2-Dimethyl-1-propanol (at concn of 50 mM) stimulates in vitro the peptidase activity (by 160%) but inhibits the esterase activity (by 76%) of carboxypeptidase A.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Snyder, R. (ed.). Ethel Browning's Toxicity and Metabolism of Industrial Solvents. Second Edition. Volume 3 Alcohols and Esters. New York, NY: Elsevier, 1992., p. 132
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: 2,2-Dimethyl-1-propanol inhibits the cytochrome p450 dependent mixed function oxidases, specificaly aniline hydroxylase, in suspensions of rat liver microsomes.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Snyder, R. (ed.). Ethel Browning's Toxicity and Metabolism of Industrial Solvents. Second Edition. Volume 3 Alcohols and Esters. New York, NY: Elsevier, 1992., p. 132
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: The concn (H50) which caused 50% hemolysis of rabbit erythrocytes in isotonic saline, 1 hr at 37 °C, is 2,2-dimethyl-1-propanol, 128 mM. The concn (ID50) required to produce 50% inhibition of cell growth of mouse fibroblast L cells is 2,2-dimethyl-1-propanol, 10.8 mM.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clayton, G. D. and F. E. Clayton (eds.). Patty's Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology: Volume 2A, 2B, 2C: Toxicology. 3rd ed. New York: John Wiley Sons, 1981-1982., p. 4590
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: All /amyl alcohols/ are appreciably irritating to the eyes and capable of causing transient corneal opacity. All are somewhat irritating to the uncovered skin when exposures are repeated and severely irritating when confined to the skin. All can be absorbed through the skin of animals in toxic amts when exposures are severe. High conc of vapor are irritating to the mucous membranes and typically cause central nervous system effects and death by respiratory failure. /Amyl alcohols/

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Hansch C et al; Exploring QSAR Hydrophobic, Electronic, and Steric Constants. ACS Professional Reference Book. Heller SR, (consult ed) Washington, DC: Amer Chem Soc pg. 15 (1995) (2) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods. Washington DC: Amer Chem Soc pp. 4-9 (1990) (3) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 23 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: The Koc of neopentyl alcohol is estimated as approximately 123(SRC), using an experimental log Kow of 1.31(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a recommended classification scheme(3), this estimated Koc value suggests that neopentyl alcohol has high mobility in soil(SRC).
